verses.text: Awake, awake; put on thy strength, O Zion; Put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city: For henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.
Shake thyself from the dust; arise, \add and\add* sit down, O Jerusalem: Loose thyself from the bands of thy neck, O captive daughter of Zion.
For thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Ye have sold yourselves for nought; And ye shall be redeemed without money.
For thus saith the Lord \sc God\sc*, My people went down aforetime \add into\add* Egypt to sojourn there; And the Assyrian oppressed them without cause.

Now therefore, what have I here, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, That my people is taken away for nought? They that rule over them make \add them\add* to howl, saith the \sc Lord\sc*; And my name continually every day \add is\add* blasphemed.
Therefore my people shall know my name: Therefore \add they shall know\add* in that day that I \add am\add* he that doth speak: behold, \add it is\add* I.

How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace; That bringeth good tidings of good, that publisheth salvation; That saith unto Zion, Thy God reigneth!
Thy watchmen shall lift up the voice; \add With\add* the voice together shall they sing: For they shall see eye to eye, When the \sc Lord\sc* shall bring again Zion.
Break forth into joy, sing together, ye waste places of Jerusalem: For the \sc Lord\sc* hath comforted his people, he hath redeemed Jerusalem.
The \sc Lord\sc* hath made bare his holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; And all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of our God.
Depart ye, depart ye, go ye out from thence, touch no unclean \add thing;\add* Go ye out of the midst of her; be ye clean, that bear the vessels of the \sc Lord\sc*.
For ye shall not go out with haste, Nor go by flight: For the \sc Lord\sc* will go before you; And the God of Israel \add will be\add* your rereward.
Behold, my servant shall deal prudently, He shall be exalted and extolled, and be very high.
As many were astonied at thee; His visage \add was\add* so marred more than \add any\add* man, And his form more than the sons of men:

So shall he sprinkle many nations; The kings shall shut their mouths at him: For \add that\add* which had not been told them shall they see; And \add that\add* which they had not heard shall they consider.
